intro: Cyrtandra incompta, commonly known as the Hawaiian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and coastal areas. Its leaves are usually oval-shaped with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Cyrtandra incompta plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, supporting various pollinators and contributing to the biodiversity of Hawaiian ecosystems.
